New Records: Virat Kohli became the second India batter to score 3000 runs in international cricket against South Africa.
Virat Kohli equalled Sachin Tendulkar in becoming only the second batter in the history of ODI cricket to reach 6000 runs at home.
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli grafted the Indian innings against South Africa at Eden Gardens after Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill fell in quick succession inside 11 overs.
Virat Kohli and Shreyas Iyer added 103 runs between themselves from 126 balls.
Virat Kohli completed his half-century from 67 balls.
